section.name: Exercises for test 3
section.topText: The following exercises give you practice with the ten questions that will be asked in the third mastery test.
section.page: This exercise asks whether three statements describe parameters or estimates.

page.nameOverride: Find probability about cards or dice

section.page: This exercise asks for probabilities about a card drawn at random from a standard pack of playing cards or when two dice are rolled.
This exercise relates to pairs of numbers drawn with or without replacement from a small finite population. The question asks for a probability about either the sum or difference of the two numbers.
This exercise describes four random variables and asks which have binomial distributions.

page.nameOverride: Find binomial prob from a barchart

section.page: In this exercise, you will use the information in the question to set the parameters of a binomial distribution then read off the probability by dragging over the bar chart of the binomial probabilities. (The computer does the calculations.)

page.nameOverride: Find binomial prob using normal approx

section.page: This exercise asks for probabilities relating to a binomial distribution but requires that you use a normal approximation to evaluate them.
In this exercise, probabilities are obtained from the areas under a probability density function.
This exercise shows a normal distribution and asks you to guess its standard deviation.
This exercise asks for a normal probability. It must first be translated into a question involving a z-score.
The exercise on this page ask the inverse question; given a probability, what is the corresponding range of values? The exercise uses a normal table to find the answer.
